page.description: Filter in/out words that match (using smatch) the pattern, default delimiter is CR-LF.
page.syntax: String_Array[] as C = FILTER_STRING_SMATCH(C string ,C pattern,[C delimiter[,L exclude]])

argument.name: string
argument.description: A character string separated into "records" by the character string Delimiter.

argument.name: pattern
argument.description: A character string to find in each "record" of the Input_List. Can include the '*' and '? ' wildcard characters.

argument.name: delimiter
argument.description: A character string that separates the Input_List into multiple "records".

argument.name: exclude
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. The default value for Exclude_Flag is .F. (FALSE).
.T. = The String_Array[] excludes the "records" that contain sub-string.
.F. = The String_Array[] contains only the "records" that contain the Find_String.

page.discussion: FILTER_STRING_SMATCH() takes an Input_List that is divided into logical "records" by a Delimiter and either extracts or excludes the "records" that contain the Find_String characters anywhere within each "record" in the string. This function is typically used in Xbasic scripts. It is extremely useful for manipulating the CR-LF delimited strings that are returned by many of the Alpha Anywhere methods (such as A5.FORM_ENUM()). NOTE : FILTER_STRING_SMATCH() is not case sensitive.
page.example: list = <<%a% Alpha Software The Alpha Project Project Alpha %a% ? filter_string(list, "alpha", crlf() ) = Alpha Software The Alpha Project Project Alpha ? filter_string_smatch(list, "alpha", crlf() ) = "" ? filter_string_smatch(list, "alpha*", crlf() ) = Alpha Software ? filter_string_smatch(list, "*alpha", crlf() ) = Project Alpha ? filter_string_smatch(list, "*alpha*", crlf() ) = Alpha Software The Alpha Project Project Alpha
